Reviews.Title: Looks good, responsive, nice size, ok battery, bad resolution, slow trackpad, has a fan
Reviews.Author: Kaitlyn
Reviews.Content: I have had this PC for about 2 hours. I am using it to write the review.My first impressions are:It looks nice, seems well built and is more like a laptop than a tablet. It is black and has a matte finish. It is big enough to be used as a laptop.It has a fan in the tablet part. It runs cool and Isn't too loud but is noticeable in a quiet room. If fans really bother you, look at the cheaper 11 inch version of this PC that uses the new Intel Atom Bay Trail processor. It will run slower, but the trade off is no fan, lower cost and more battery life.It has very good battery life. I used it for over a hour without a full charge with games, updates and web browsing and it didn't go down much in tablet mode.Big screen that I find nice for movies and games in tablet mode.Low resolution, is very noticeable in pictures while surfing the web. Try the 11 inch version if this bothers you. In movies and games it isn't as bad because the pixels are moving.The touch pad on the keyboard isn't very responsive. I immediately had to change the mouse to the fastest setting, which makes it usable. The fact that you can always touch the screen or get an external mouse makes this not a big deal. Maybe it will be improved with a driver update later.It uses Windows 8.1Update:The battery seems to last between 4 and 7 hours of constant use depending on what your settings are and what you are doing. If you set it to turn off the display, go to sleep when not used, and hibernate when closed it could last you all day unless you plan to use it most of the day unplugged.Tips: Try the free Granola Power Management software. It extended the battery life about 25%. Also switch to power saver mode and turn off Bluetooth if not in use.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet, bad laptop
Reviews.Author: Kyle
Reviews.Content: I purchased this computer because I liked that fact that it can be taken apart from the keyboard and used as a tablet. This feature is great and if you intend to use it primarily without the keyboard then I would recommend it. However, if you, like myself, want a laptop first and a tablet second, I can't recommend it. Here are some of the reasons why:1. The mouse-pad is awful. It does not have individual left and right buttons so half the time you try to right click it left clicks (even when clicking all the way to the right). When using the left click function, or simply tapping the mouse-pad, at times it takes multiple clicks to respond.2. There are times when the cursor/keyboard freezes for seemingly no reason.3. Have had 2 blue screens in the month I've had it with relativity light use.4. Keyboard is too small for my liking. I know this is part of getting a tablet/laptop combo, but it is smaller than I anticipated.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet/Laptop
Reviews.Author: Gil Lopez Gerardo Daniel
Reviews.Content: Excellent hybrid tablet laptop, its very fast and responsive, excelent for work and home. It comes with Windows 8.1 wich is great too.

Reviews.Title: A Tablet That Can Perform On a Budget
Reviews.Author: J. Webber
Reviews.Content: At first, I hated the HP Pavilion x 13. Too big, too much and it felt a little heavy (4.9 pounds). The screen is bright and vivid and the 720p resolution suits this form factor well. Performance is snappy on the desktop, when installing apps, and when browsing the internet.Like a laptop but in a manageable tablet size. It lays perfectly on your lap and is surprisingly comfortable to use in tablet mode.Can play most games (League of Legends, WoW, Diablo III, SC II, Fez, etc)League of Legends plays at the 1368 x 768 resolution at 60fps. However, I want to point out that I could not get the track pad to work with league of legends. I had to use a USB mouse (which is ok, I would never play an RTS game without a traditional mouse)The tablet DOES have a fan in the system on the tablet portion for cooling purposes. You can also upgrade the RAM to 8GB and install a 2.5"HDD in the keyboard base for increased storage (will be attempting both of these upgrades and will report back with the results).Nicely done HP.

Reviews.Title: It's great
Reviews.Author: Don Hubbard
Reviews.Content: It has been frustrating at times, but when I took time to read the directions it became easier and really fun.

Reviews.Title: Very Satisfied With HP Pavillion x2 13-P110NR
Reviews.Author: Raymond M Lombardi
Reviews.Content: Very good performance and excellent graphic capability but battery discharges too quickly!  HP needs to develop a battery that will hold a longer charge.

Reviews.Title: A great piece of hardware for the price
Reviews.Author: Christopher Seider "A serious, detailed guy"
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with the responsiveness and am working my way through understanding Windows 8.1.  Yes, this has the updated version of Windows 8.

Reviews.Title: It is ok
Reviews.Author: kaixu1026
Reviews.Content: I bought this laptop for my father in law. It is an OK product because it fits my requirement based on the budget when I bought that with a discount. However, I don't think I will buy it with a full price because of the following reasons.1. The laptop is relatively heavy. I don't know why the lower part base is so heavy. I guess they want the station is stable.2. The conjunction part looks very fragile. I am always fair to break it. I will count that as a bad design3. Touch screen sometimes doesn't work well.

Reviews.Title: Great computer
Reviews.Author: eric beyer
Reviews.Content: This laptop/tablet has a lot of fun features, and it's multipurpose use as a tablet or laptop come in handy. Wish it came loaded with Microsoft office, but everything else is good.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic piece of product.
Reviews.Author: Arnold Zimbiri
Reviews.Content: Quite fast and sensitive to the touch. However the docking station is slightly heavy. Good value for money. would recommend it.

ProductInfo.Features:
Intel i3-4020Y 1.5 GHz
4 GB DDR3L SDRAM
128 GB Solid-State Drive
13.3-Inch Screen, Intel HD graphics 4400
ProductInfo.Name: HP Pavilion 13-P110NR 13.3-Inch Detachable 2 in 1 Touchscreen Laptop
